title: National Park Service Asks Visitors to Please Stop Licking Toads
description: The Sonoran desert toad’s toxins create an intense psychedelic experience, but that’s not an excuse to put one in your mouth.
dc:creator: Daniel Victor
media:credit: Adam Riding for The New York Times
media:description: The Sonoran desert toad excretes a toxin that produces a psychedelic experience when dried into crystals and smoked in a pipe. Some National Park visitors have tried licking the toads.
